title: Small Soraka buff suggestion: Speed up the heal projectile from Starcall
body:
When you hit an enemy Champion with Starcall, there's a projectile that flies back to Soraka to heal her. Unfortunately, it often takes too long, and Soraka can die before it reaches her at long ranges.

It'd be nice if those projectiles got a speed increase. Note that I don't mean the comet itself; just the part that goes back to her to heal her.

replies.body:
I'm looking into a number of potential changes for her in the patch after this next one. The missile speed was actually put in so you could see how many hits you got on Q and then choose whether or not to heal an ally before they reached you (because they heal more when you're at lower health) as a small optimization. Also, having them move too fast would disrupt a lot of the clarity of the enemy seeing whether or not they were hit and where Soraka's healing is coming from. We could possibly speed them up some, but I'm not sure if that's the place I really would want to buff Soraka. Right now I'm primarily looking at her E cooldown (possibly raising it), her W range (possible increasing it) and her Q cast paradigm (changing it to fixed travel time instead of variable depending on distance. this would be a nerf at close range but a buff at far ranges and will also increase how understandable/usable the spell is for a number of players).

All of this is tentative though, but those are the things I'm looking at primarily. She might not need any of that at all but we will be testing some changes. I'm more concerned with usability/fairness than power right now because it's hard to get a good power read with all of the preseason changes being tested right now. For instance, with the new Dragon granting increasing buffs, Soraka is naturally more powerful because she allows certain junglers to take dragon extremely early with her heals.

I read you aren't going to focus on her power right now, but I'd like to say something about her itemization:
Buying health is double-edged because it costs her more health to cast Astral Infusion but she doesn't get any compensation for that extra health loss. And since, as a support, you have to buy the sightstone as early as possible, and seeing that sightstone gives you health but no health regen to compensate, it puts you in the situation where you sacrifice a lot of health without regaining it quickly enough.
I think (but I might be wrong) that giving her a health ratio either on her heal (to give the extra loss purpose) or on her self-heal (to compensate the loss) could help her with this itemization issue.

Hey Vesh,

Having played about 35 games as support Soraka post-rework, I just want to throw my 2rp into the ring.  

When evaluating a champion's kit, you obviously know very well that "fun" is not comparable to "damage," "mana cost," "cooldown duration," or any of the other values that dictate a champion's overall power.  I assume that's a big part of why you worked on Soraka's new kit - she's substantially more *enjoyable* to play following this rework.  Even if, as you say, Soraka might not need any of the aforementioned changes in terms of her in-game strength (perhaps you are already happy with her new pick/win rates), I do think that she would massively benefit from another increase to her "fun" levels. 

Having to move in close to an allied champion in order to transfer your health to the target creates FAR more interesting game mechanics than the previous Soraka's kit - but proves frustrating and feels anti-fun in certain circumstances.  For example, I've often found that moving up to heal the frontline can actually be a greater risk than potential reward in that you can easily end up dying without accomplishing much at all, leaving your backline without a support.  In Soraka's current form, the famous line displayed on the supercomputer's screen in John Badham's 1983 film, *WarGames,*  sometimes proves true: "the only winning move is not to play."

Therefore, I strongly feel that you should internally test increasing the range on Soraka's W with nerfs to other areas of her kit in order to try to strike a balance between the increased range and the strength of heal.  Obviously changes to range are difficult to balance in relation to other areas of a kit (like in Lucian's rework, where the reduction of his AA range was answered with too many buffs) - but I would be hard-pressed to think of a design reason to obstruct making a champion more fun to play as; because if we're not having fun, why are we playing League of Legends?

Thanks for reading.

Best,

Earl

Hey Earl! 

In development I had to walk a very fine line with the W range to get the accessibility I wanted for the character while preserving functionality. Because we were introducing a true healer into League, Morello, myself, and a lot of our live designers wanted to be very careful with how safe she was allowed to be (nothing more frustrating than a safe healer). We might have pushed too far here, and another 50 range might do wonders while still keeping her vulnerable. It's a really crazy buff though, and I expect that she would need a nerf elsewhere to compensate (base stats perhaps, but still exploring all of our options). Glad you're enjoying her though! I promise I'll keep working to make her the best she can be for League (by best I mean fun... not powerful :p )

I feel that you guys are being overly cautious with Soraka's rework. Yeah, a safe healer is extremely unfun to play, but she's a support that the current meta is *very* disapproving of: she is neither an engage support or a disengage support. Her CC is very weak and easy to dodge, and she herself is quite squishy (and is discouraged from building health). Healing is the *only* thing she provides to the team, and since you guys are doing a great job at making her healing involve danger and interaction with the enemy, it means that Soraka requires a lot of skill that doesn't really correlate with her impact on the game.

From what I've been playing, Soraka excels when her team is self-sufficient. This means that her ADC needs to be safe and/or self-peeling (Ezreal, Caitlyn, maybe Jinx), and the other players need to be able to engage/disengage on their own. If these (extremely rare) conditions are met, Soraka shines brightly, being able to keep her entire team alive throughout an entire teamfight and easily pushing her team towards a great advantage.

However, if these conditions are not met (because most people love to pick very squishy and unsafe champions that require a lot of support babysitting), Soraka's effectiveness compared to other supports falls drastically. She has virtually no peel, engage or pick potential, she can't heal people who are so squishy that they die in one hit, and she can't deal with high-damage, dive-heavy comps. She also struggles when her entire team is made of squishies (Riven top, Yi jungle, Lucian ADC and Zed mid, for example, your typical soloqueue comp) and she can't figure out who is the highest priority target to heal.

To be honest, I feel Soraka needs the W range buff, but she cannot afford any more nerfs. In fact, I'd say that 50 units of W casting, while very welcome, will not solve any of the above problems. She needs to be so good at what she does that she can actually compete with supports that offer heavy CC on top of utility, such as Morgana, Nami, Sona, Thresh, Janna and Leona. If you guys don't want to give her reliable hard CC or tankiness, that's fine, but she definitely needs more than what she already has in order to be a viable competitive pick. While the other supports I mentioned fit into any teamcomp, the fact that Soraka needs a specific teamcomp tailored after her indicates that she's not in a strong place right now.

> We might have pushed too far here, and another 50 range might do wonders while still keeping her vulnerable. It's a really crazy buff though, and I expect that she would need a nerf elsewhere to compensate (base stats perhaps, but still exploring all of our options).

You were overly cautious before, and you kind of still are. Certainly better than being reckless though. :p
50 range is a very welcome buff, and it'll help reduce incidental AoE damage to her, but it's really not a "crazy" buff. It's something she likely should've had from the start. Backline champions do not function well on the frontline for obvious reasons, especially not Soraka.

Strangely enough i think Raka is in a pretty good status, minus some small blips here or there. Q's variable time length REALLY helps when i want to protect my carry at close range, and over time i've gotten used to the timing differences. Hitting it feels great at all levels, and really cements her power in counter engages. The slow part of her long ranged Q i feel is justified by the amount of harass she can consistantly do from such a far range. It creates some really interesting zoning potential that I've really enjoyed getting used to.

I also completely understand the rationale behind the healing projectiles too. If i hit multiple targets with my Q i can get some pretty crazy amounts of hp back, and working around the travel times helps me optimize my healing, while also giving me much needed areas of weakness for when enemies come after me (Which they should given my shiny new importance as a pain in the ass healer) If Raka is too easily able to regain her Hp then she wont die, which needs to happen since she's so important now. a larger healing Radius would be quite nice though, since it can be outright oppressive at times when my teammates are always barely out of range since i need to be forearm deep in their healthpool to get them back to fighting stance. Again of course it can't be raised much since she needs to be vulnerable while healing.

Equinox is really strong, but its already long Cd makes it super punishing if you miss it, especially since its soooo hard to get the root off in any practical situation, and is one of the bigger areas i feel raka has problems. Mobile carries get out of its range and straight to killing me or my carry with hardly any delay, and only really feel the pain when i have allies to keep them in the circle.

In regards to things i think new raka really suffers from i'd say she's a little too dependant on itemization to get catches (Long range Qs are nearly impossible to hit sweet spots on purpose, so i get FQC or Rylais to improve my catch chances) and that her passive has some unintended problems in revealing information to her enemies.

On occasion my jungler is low hp and fighting like golems or something. I randomly get my speed boost in a direction, which enemies can readily see to know that not only is someone near me, but that they're ripe for the killing. Since its a straight line, they also get a damn good sense of what direction and where my teammate may be, when otherwise they'd have no knowledge of it whatsoever. Its a bit problematic, but i'd like to see if something could be done to protect Raka's teammates.

Personally I think all three of your proposed changes sound wonderful. Equinox is probably her strongest ability besides her ult, which is unusual considering that she's supposed to be the best at healing. Her W would be her best ability, but it only works well if the enemy decides to not blow her up when she's using it (that or she'll just die to AoE). 
I like the idea of her Q being worse at close-range but more reliable at long-range, since going into close-range as Soraka is the exact thing one should be avoiding with her. Makes things less clunky too.

I don't think the HP cost should be changed personally. I really, really wouldn't want to play against a tanky Soraka that can heal a lot. Building Sightstone only increases her heal cost by 15, which isn't really such a big deal. Either way the problem doesn't really lie in your design of Soraka, it's more about the lack of sightstone variation (eg. AP Sightstone, CDR Sightstone, etc), but that sort of stuff is more in Xypherous' area.
